body_html:
This was solved in tensorboardX issues. Here the thread: lanpa/tensorboardX#154

The solution is to install the latest version of both pytorch and tensorboardX respectively using the following commands:
conda install -c pytorch pytorch-nightly and pip install git+https://github.com/lanpa/tensorboard-pytorch
Then this message becomes a warning instead of an exception.

/home/dexter/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/onnx/symbolic.py:69: UserWarning: ONNX export failed on upsample_bilinear2d because align_corners == True not supported
  warnings.warn("ONNX export failed on " + op + " because " + msg + " not supported")

Edit: Alternatively, the next release 1.0 is planned to be released this summer and includes the fix. https://pytorch.org/2018/05/02/road-to-1.0.html

Edit2: The solution explained works if you want to use tensorboardX. For just pytorch and ONNX the solution would be also to update ONNX and pytorch to the latests versions, without the need of installing tensorboardX additionally.

body:
This was solved in tensorboardX issues. Here the thread: https://github.com/lanpa/tensorboard-pytorch/issues/154 

The solution is to install the latest version of both pytorch and tensorboardX respectively using the following commands:
` conda install -c pytorch pytorch-nightly` and `pip install git+https://github.com/lanpa/tensorboard-pytorch`
Then this message becomes a warning instead of an exception.
```
/home/dexter/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/onnx/symbolic.py:69: UserWarning: ONNX export failed on upsample_bilinear2d because align_corners == True not supported
  warnings.warn("ONNX export failed on " + op + " because " + msg + " not supported")
```

Edit: Alternatively, the next release 1.0 is planned to be released this summer and includes the fix. https://pytorch.org/2018/05/02/road-to-1.0.html

Edit2: The solution explained works if you want to use tensorboardX. For just pytorch and ONNX the solution would be also to update ONNX and pytorch to the latests versions, without the need of installing tensorboardX additionally.
